results.title: James Galway Program 4
results.brief_description: Siner, Maureen Braithwaite is introduced by James Galway, flautist, and joined by percussionist, Evelyn Glennie and clarinettist, Emma Johnson, to perform “Danse Macabre” (sung) by Saint Saens, “Sonata Finale” by Poulenc, “Donde Leiter” from “La Boheme” by Puccini, “Study on Black Keys” by Chopin, “Jeannie with the Light Brown Hair”, “Tambourin Chinois” by Kriesler, “Summertime” by Gershwin. Rated: G

results.title: Sailing the Greek Isles
results.brief_description: Join Scott Lambert and three other Australians, along with a Greek skipper, for a month among the beautiful Greek Islands. Visit the island of Mykonos with its wonderful Cubist architecture, Rhodes with its castles of the Knights of St John built over 500 years ago, Siftos and Santorini. Legend has it that Santorini, the island on the rim of a giant volcanic crater, and believed to be the home of vampires, is the site of the lost city of Atlantis. Then travel with the group to Turkey, home of the traditional enemies of the Greeks, and visit Effasis the second largest city of the Roman Empire, and then on to see the reputed house of the Virgin Mary.

results.title: Guitar
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video School of Music Series”.
With this series you can be taught professionally in your own home. You can replay difficult sections and of course have the same lesson over and over again. This video takes you through the basics of guitar playing with Steve Crofts, a protege of George Goller. Rated: G

results.title: Hellfire Pass
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Geoffrey Barnes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: On Anzac Day 1987, Sir Edmund “Weary” Dunlop and a group of ex-servicemen from Australia, Britain and Holland returned to the infamous Thai-Burma railway to dedicate Hellfire Pass as a monument to those who died. This film is their journey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham Chase, Geoffrey Barnes and Film Australia

results.title: Looking into paintings 1-6
results.creator_credit: Charles Mapleston and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: In this program Robert Cumming, Director of the Christie Fine Art Course, Norbert Lynton, Professor of Fine Art at Sussex University, and Alistair Smith, Keeper at the National gallery, help us look into paintings rather than just at them. They take us through some famous paintings, sometimes with the help of other experts, always with new ways of approaching the pictures, and with added insights, from contemporary artists, into the art of painting.

results.title: Keating on Monet
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating recreates a river-side scene in winter using Monet painting techniques. Monet often worked on the River Seine in his painting boat. Keating provides biographical details, discusses his painter colleagues and their support of each other, his poverty and the difficulties in painting nature.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Keating on Manet
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating recreates the Manet painting “Olympia”, providing short biographical details, explaining the confident way in which he painted, expressing form very simply and juxtaposing warm and cool in his compositions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Keating on Titian
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating discusses Titian’s early life and the artists who influenced his work. Keating recreates “Tarquin and Lucretia” taking the viewer through the various stages including scumbling, glazing and impasto.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
